metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3733 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
There's a flaw in urllib's AbstractBasicAuthHandler class. An attacker who controls a malicious HTTP server that an HTTP client (such as web browser) connects to, could trigger a Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDOS) during an authentication request with a specially crafted payload that is sent by the server to the client. The greatest threat that this flaw poses is to application availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3733` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
libpython3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
libpython3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
libpython3.4-stdlib - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
libpython3.4-testsuite - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
python3.4 - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
python3.4-examples - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
python3.4-minimal - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
python3.4-venv - 3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: leosilva> code affected in hirsute and devel is already patched, so both releases in python3.9 are not affected.

criterions.comment: python3.4 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.4.3-1ubuntu1~14.04.7+esm11').
python3.5 package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
